name: restimulate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to encourage something to grow, develop, or become active again: Most companies have tried to lower prices so people can buy more and re-stimulate the economy. Therapists should anticipate that they will restimulate deep and often troubling feelings for many patients.
biology
  specialized to cause a physical or biological process to start again: The plant has shown remarkable progress in restimulating the growth of nerve cell receptors in rats. Take a brisk 15-minute walk around the neighbourhood to help restimulate the hormones associated with alertness.
More examplesFewer examplesThey are initiating a rate reduction scheme to restimulate the economy.The government should focus on trying to restimulate lending and borrowing now.Such apparently harmless discussions can restimulate unconscious feelings.
